query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 S’ïo avessi le rime aspre e chiocce, 2 come si converrebbe al tristo buco 3 sovra ’l qual pontan tutte l’altre rocce,
4 io premerei di mio concetto il suco 5 più pienamente; ma perch’ io non l’abbo, 6 non sanza tema a dicer mi conduco;
7 ché non è impresa da pigliare a gabbo 8 discriver fondo a tutto l’universo, 9 né da lingua che chiami mamma o babbo.
query.result:
**English:**
1 If I had the harsh and hoarse rhymes, 2 as would be fitting for the dismal hole 3 over which all the other rocks jut out,
4 I would express the essence of my conception 5 more fully; but because I do not have them, 6 not without fear do I bring myself to speak;
7 for it is no enterprise to be taken lightly 8 to describe the depths of the entire universe, 9 nor for a tongue that calls for mother or father.
**Malay:**
1 Sekiranya aku mempunyai rima-rima yang kasar dan serak, 2 seperti yang sesuai untuk lubang yang menyedihkan 3 yang di atasnya semua batu-batu lain menjorok keluar,
4 aku akan mengungkapkan intisari dari konsepsiku 5 dengan lebih lengkap; tetapi karena aku tidak memilikinya, 6 bukan tanpa rasa takut aku membawa diriku untuk berbicara;
7 karena bukanlah suatu usaha yang dapat dianggap enteng 8 untuk menggambarkan kedalaman seluruh alam semesta, 9 atau untuk lidah yang memanggil ibu atau ayah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Ma quelle donne aiutino il mio verso 11 ch’aiutaro Anfïone a chiuder Tebe, 12 sì che dal fatto il dir non sia diverso.
query.result:
**English:**
10 But may those ladies help my verse 11 who helped Amphion to enclose Thebes, 12 so that the telling may not be different from the deed.
**Malay:**
10 Tetapi para wanita itu membantu syairku 11 yang membantu Amphion untuk menutup Thebes, 12 sehingga apa yang terjadi tidak berbeda dengan apa yang dikatakan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 Oh sovra tutte mal creata plebe 14 che stai nel loco onde parlare è duro, 15 mei foste state qui pecore o zebe!
16 Come noi fummo giù nel pozzo scuro 17 sotto i piè del gigante assai più bassi, 18 e io mirava ancora a l’alto muro,
19 dicere udi’mi: «Guarda come passi: 20 va sì, che tu non calchi con le piante 21 le teste de’ fratei miseri lassi».
query.result:
**English:**
13 Oh, you people created worse than all evil, 14 who are in the place where it is hard to speak, 15 I wish you had been sheep or goats here!
16 As we were down in the dark pit, 17 much lower than the giant’s feet, 18 and I was still looking at the high wall,
19 I heard someone say to me: “Watch how you step: 20 go so that you do not tread with your feet 21 on the heads of your wretched, weary brothers.”
**Malay:**
13 Oh, kamu semua manusia yang diciptakan lebih buruk dari semua kejahatan, 14 yang berada di tempat yang sulit untuk berbicara, 15 aku berharap kamu menjadi domba atau kambing di sini!
16 Ketika kami berada di dalam lubang yang gelap, 17 jauh lebih rendah dari kaki raksasa itu, 18 dan aku masih melihat ke dinding yang tinggi,
19 kudengar seseorang berkata kepadaku: “Hati-hati dengan langkahmu: 20 berjalanlah sedemikian rupa sehingga kamu tidak menginjak 21 kepala saudara-saudaramu yang malang dan lelah.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Per ch’io mi volsi, e vidimi davante 23 e sotto i piedi un lago che per gelo 24 avea di vetro e non d’acqua sembiante.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Whereupon I turned, and saw before me 23 and beneath my feet a lake that, because of the frost, 24 seemed to be of glass and not of water.
**Malay:**
22 Maka berpalinglah aku, dan melihat di depanku 23 dan di bawah kakiku sebuah danau yang, karena es, 24 tampak seperti kaca dan bukan air.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Non fece al corso suo sì grosso velo 26 di verno la Danoia in Osterlicchi, 27 né Tanaï là sotto ’l freddo cielo,
28 com’ era quivi; che se Tambernicchi 29 vi fosse sù caduto, o Pietrapana, 30 non avria pur da l’orlo fatto cricchi.
query.result:
**English:**
25 The Danube in Austria never made so thick a veil 26 of ice in winter, 27 nor the Don River there beneath the cold sky,
28 as was here; that if Mount Tambura or Pietrapana 29 had fallen on it, 30 it would not have made a crack at the edge.
**Malay:**
25 Sungai Danube di Austria tidak pernah membuat selubung yang begitu tebal 26 dari es di musim dingin, 27 begitu juga Sungai Don di sana di bawah langit yang dingin,
28 seperti yang ada di sini; jika Gunung Tambura atau Pietrapana 29 telah jatuh di atasnya, 30 itu tidak akan membuat retakan di tepinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 E come a gracidar si sta la rana 32 col muso fuor de l’acqua, quando sogna 33 di spigolar sovente la villana,
34 livide, insin là dove appar vergogna 35 eran l’ombre dolenti ne la ghiaccia, 36 mettendo i denti in nota di cicogna.
query.result:
**English:**
31 And as a frog sits croaking 32 with its snout out of the water, when the peasant woman dreams 33 of gleaning often,
34 livid, up to where shame appears, 35 were the sorrowful shades in the ice, 36 chattering their teeth like storks.
**Malay:**
31 Dan seperti katak yang sedang berkokok 32 dengan moncongnya keluar dari air, ketika wanita petani bermimpi 33 untuk sering memungut sisa-sisa panen,
34 pucat pasi, sampai di tempat di mana rasa malu muncul, 35 adalah bayangan-bayangan yang sedih di dalam es, 36 menggeretakkan gigi mereka seperti burung bangau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Ognuna in giù tenea volta la faccia; 38 da bocca il freddo, e da li occhi il cor tristo 39 tra lor testimonianza si procaccia.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Each one kept her face turned downward; 38 from their mouths came the cold, and from their eyes the sorrowful heart 39 sought to bear witness to each other.
**Malay:**
37 Masing-masing menundukkan wajahnya; 38 dari mulut keluar hawa dingin, dan dari mata hati yang sedih 39 di antara mereka mencari kesaksian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Quand’ io m’ebbi dintorno alquanto visto, 41 volsimi a’ piedi, e vidi due sì stretti, 42 che ’l pel del capo avieno insieme misto.
query.result:
**English:**
40 When I had looked around me for a while, 41 I turned to my feet and saw two so narrow, 42 that the hair of their heads was mixed together.
**Malay:**
40 Ketika aku telah melihat sekelilingku untuk beberapa saat, 41 aku menoleh ke kakiku, dan melihat dua yang begitu sempit, 42 sehingga rambut kepala mereka bercampur menjadi satu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 «Ditemi, voi che sì strignete i petti», 44 diss’ io, «chi siete?». E quei piegaro i colli; 45 e poi ch’ebber li visi a me eretti,
46 li occhi lor, ch’eran pria pur dentro molli, 47 gocciar su per le labbra, e ’l gelo strinse 48 le lagrime tra essi e riserrolli.
query.result:
**English:**
43 "Tell me, you who huddle together so tightly," 44 I said, "who are you?" And they bowed their heads; 45 and after they had lifted their faces toward me,
46 their eyes, which were soft before, now streamed 47 down over their lips, and the cold froze 48 the tears between them and sealed them shut.
**Malay:**
43 "Katakan padaku, kamu yang merapatkan dada," 44 kataku, "siapa kamu?" Dan mereka menundukkan kepala; 45 dan setelah mereka mengangkat wajah mereka ke arahku,
46 mata mereka, yang sebelumnya lembut, sekarang mengalir 47 ke bawah bibir mereka, dan dingin membekukan 48 air mata di antara mereka dan menutupnya rapat-rapat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Con legno legno spranga mai non cinse 50 forte così; ond’ ei come due becchi 51 cozzaro insieme, tanta ira li vinse.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Wood with wood never bound together 50 so tightly; so that they, like two billy goats, 51 clashed together, so much anger overcame them.
**Malay:**
49 Kayu dengan kayu tidak pernah diikat bersama 50 sedemikian kuatnya; sehingga mereka, seperti dua ekor kambing jantan, 51 saling beradu, begitu banyak kemarahan yang menguasai mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 E un ch’avea perduti ambo li orecchi 53 per la freddura, pur col viso in giùe, 54 disse: «Perché cotanto in noi ti specchi?
55 Se vuoi saper chi son cotesti due, 56 la valle onde Bisenzo si dichina 57 del padre loro Alberto e di lor fue.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And one who had lost both his ears 53 from the cold, with his face still downward, 54 said: "Why do you gaze so intently at us?
55 If you wish to know who these two are, 56 the valley from which the Bisenzio descends 57 was the birthplace of their father Alberto and of them.
**Malay:**
52 Dan seorang yang telah kehilangan kedua telinganya 53 karena kedinginan, meskipun wajahnya masih menunduk, 54 berkata: "Mengapa kamu menatap kami begitu tajam?
55 Jika kamu ingin tahu siapa kedua orang ini, 56 lembah tempat Bisenzio mengalir 57 adalah tempat kelahiran ayah mereka Alberto dan mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 D’un corpo usciro; e tutta la Caina 59 potrai cercare, e non troverai ombra 60 degna più d’esser fitta in gelatina:
61 non quelli a cui fu rotto il petto e l’ombra 62 con esso un colpo per la man d’Artù; 63 non Focaccia; non questi che m’ingombra
64 col capo sì, ch’i’ non veggio oltre più, 65 e fu nomato Sassol Mascheroni; 66 se tosco se’, ben sai omai chi fu.
query.result:
**English:**
58 From one body they came out; and all of Caina 59 you will be able to search, and you will not find a shade 60 more worthy of being stuck in jelly:
61 not those whose chest and shade were pierced 62 with one blow by the hand of Arthur; 63 not Focaccia; not this one who obstructs me
64 with his head, so that I can see no further, 65 and he was named Sassol Mascheroni; 66 if you are Tuscan, you now know well who he was.
**Malay:**
58 Dari satu tubuh mereka keluar; dan seluruh Caina 59 kamu akan dapat mencari, dan kamu tidak akan menemukan bayangan 60 yang lebih layak untuk dijebloskan ke dalam agar-agar:
61 bukan mereka yang dadanya dan bayangannya ditusuk 62 dengan satu pukulan oleh tangan Arthur; 63 bukan Focaccia; bukan orang ini yang menghalangi pandanganku
64 dengan kepalanya, sehingga aku tidak dapat melihat lebih jauh, 65 dan ia bernama Sassol Mascheroni; 66 jika kamu orang Tuscan, kamu sekarang tahu betul siapa dia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 E perché non mi metti in più sermoni, 68 sappi ch’i’ fu’ il Camiscion de’ Pazzi; 69 e aspetto Carlin che mi scagioni».
query.result:
**English:**
67 And so that you do not put me into more sermons, 68 know that I was Camiscion de' Pazzi; 69 and I await Carlin who will exonerate me."
**Malay:**
67 Dan agar kamu tidak menempatkanku dalam lebih banyak khotbah, 68 ketahuilah bahwa aku adalah Camiscion de' Pazzi; 69 dan aku menunggu Carlin yang akan membebaskanku."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Poscia vid’ io mille visi cagnazzi 71 fatti per freddo; onde mi vien riprezzo, 72 e verrà sempre, de’ gelati guazzi.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Then I saw a thousand snarling, rabid faces 71 made hideous by the cold; the thought of them 72 still makes me shudder, and always will, at the frozen pools.
**Malay:**
70 Kemudian kulihat seribu wajah yang menggeram dan ganas 71 dibuat mengerikan oleh hawa dingin; yang membuatku ngeri, 72 dan akan selalu ngeri, di genangan air yang membeku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Piangendo mi sgridò: «Perché mi peste? 80 se tu non vieni a crescer la vendetta 81 di Montaperti, perché mi moleste?».
query.result:
**English:**
79 Weeping, he cried out to me: "Why do you trample on me? 80 If you do not come to avenge the vendetta 81 of Montaperti, why do you bother me?".
**Malay:**
79 Menangis dia menjerit kepadaku: "Mengapa kau injak aku? 80 Jika kau tidak datang untuk membalas dendam 81 dari Montaperti, mengapa kau ganggu aku?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 E io: «Maestro mio, or qui m’aspetta, 83 sì ch’io esca d’un dubbio per costui; 84 poi mi farai, quantunque vorrai, fretta».
query.result:
**English:**
82 And I: "My master, now wait for me here, 83 so that I may escape from a doubt because of him; 84 then you may hurry me, whenever you wish."
**Malay:**
82 Dan aku: "Tuanku, sekarang tunggulah aku di sini, 83 agar aku dapat keluar dari sebuah keraguan karena dia; 84 kemudian engkau bolehlah menyegerakan aku, kapan pun engkau mau."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Lo duca stette, e io dissi a colui 86 che bestemmiava duramente ancora: 87 «Qual se’ tu che così rampogni altrui?».
query.result:
**English:**
85 The leader stopped, and I said to the one 86 who was still cursing harshly: 87 "Who are you that you rebuke others so?"
**Malay:**
85 Pemimpin itu berhenti, dan aku berkata kepada orang itu 86 yang masih mengutuk dengan kasar: 87 "Siapakah kamu yang mencaci maki orang lain seperti itu?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 «Or tu chi se’ che vai per l’Antenora, 89 percotendo», rispuose, «altrui le gote, 90 sì che, se fossi vivo, troppo fora?».
query.result:
**English:**
88 "Now who are you who go through Antenora, 89 striking others on the cheek," he replied, 90 "so that, if you were alive, it would be too much?"
**Malay:**
88 "Sekarang siapakah engkau yang pergi melalui Antenora, 89 memukul," jawabnya, "pipi orang lain, 90 sehingga, jika engkau masih hidup, itu akan keterlaluan?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 «Vivo son io, e caro esser ti puote», 92 fu mia risposta, «se dimandi fama, 93 ch’io metta il nome tuo tra l’altre note».
query.result:
**English:**
91 "I am alive, and it can be dear to you," 92 was my answer, "if fame grants it, 93 that I place your name among the other notes."
**Malay:**
91 "Aku masih hidup, dan itu bisa berarti bagimu," 92 adalah jawabanku, "jika ketenaran mengizinkannya, 93 bahwa aku menempatkan namamu di antara catatan-catatan lainnya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Ed elli a me: «Del contrario ho io brama. 95 Lèvati quinci e non mi dar più lagna, 96 ché mal sai lusingar per questa lama!».
query.result:
**English:**
94 And he to me: "I have a desire for the opposite. 95 Get out of here and don't bother me anymore, 96 because you don't know how to flatter on this path!"
**Malay:**
94 Dan dia kepadaku: "Aku menginginkan yang sebaliknya. 95 Pergilah dari sini dan jangan ganggu aku lagi, 96 karena kamu tidak tahu bagaimana cara menyanjung di jalan ini!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Allor lo presi per la cuticagna 98 e dissi: «El converrà che tu ti nomi, 99 o che capel qui sù non ti rimagna».
query.result:
**English:**
97 Then I seized him by the scruff of the neck 98 and said: "You must tell me your name, 99 or no hair will be left on your head."
**Malay:**
97 Lalu aku menangkapnya pada tengkuknya 98 dan berkata: "Kamu harus memberitahuku namamu, 99 atau tidak akan ada sehelai rambut pun yang tersisa di kepalamu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Ond’ elli a me: «Perché tu mi dischiomi, 101 né ti dirò ch’io sia, né mosterrolti, 102 se mille fiate in sul capo mi tomi».
query.result:
**English:**
100 Then he said to me: "Why do you strip me, 101 and I will not tell you who I am, nor will I show myself to you, 102 even if you strike me on the head a thousand times."
**Malay:**
100 Kemudian dia berkata kepadaku: "Mengapa kamu menelanjangiku, 101 dan aku tidak akan memberitahumu siapa aku, atau menunjukkan diriku kepadamu, 102 bahkan jika kamu memukul kepalaku seribu kali."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Io avea già i capelli in mano avvolti, 104 e tratti glien’ avea più d’una ciocca, 105 latrando lui con li occhi in giù raccolti,
106 quando un altro gridò: «Che hai tu, Bocca? 107 non ti basta sonar con le mascelle, 108 se tu non latri? qual diavol ti tocca?».
query.result:
**English:**
103 I already had my hair wrapped in his hands, 104 and he had pulled out more than one lock, 105 barking at me with his eyes fixed on the ground,
106 when another one shouted: "What's wrong with you, Bocca? 107 Isn't it enough for you to snap your jaws, 108 without barking? What devil is driving you?".
**Malay:**
103 Aku sudah memegang rambutnya, 104 dan telah mencabut lebih dari seikat, 105 ia menggonggong padaku dengan mata tertuju ke bawah,
106 ketika yang lain berteriak: "Ada apa denganmu, Bocca? 107 Tidak cukupkah bagimu untuk menggertakkan gigi, 108 tanpa menggonggong? Setan apa yang merasukimu?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 «Omai», diss’ io, «non vo’ che più favelle, 110 malvagio traditor; ch’a la tua onta 111 io porterò di te vere novelle».
query.result:
**English:**
109 "Oh, you," I said, "I don't want any more talk, 110 evil traitor; for to your shame 111 I will carry true news of you."
**Malay:**
109 "Oh, kamu," kataku, "aku tidak ingin bicara lagi, 110 pengkhianat yang jahat; karena untuk memalukanmu 111 aku akan membawa berita benar tentangmu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 «Va via», rispuose, «e ciò che tu vuoi conta; 113 ma non tacer, se tu di qua entro eschi, 114 di quel ch’ebbe or così la lingua pronta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 "Go away," he replied, "and tell what you wish; 113 but do not be silent, if you escape from here, 114 about what made your tongue so ready just now.
**Malay:**
112 "Pergilah," jawabnya, "dan ceritakan apa yang kamu inginkan; 113 tetapi jangan diam, jika kamu keluar dari sini, 114 tentang apa yang membuat lidahmu begitu cepat tadi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 El piange qui l’argento de’ Franceschi: 116 “Io vidi”, potrai dir, “quel da Duera 117 là dove i peccatori stanno freschi”.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Here the silver of the French weeps: 116 “I saw,” you will be able to say, “that one from Douai 117 where the sinners stand refreshed.”
**Malay:**
115 Di sini perak orang-orang Prancis menangis: 116 “Aku melihat,” kamu akan dapat berkata, “orang dari Douai itu 117 di tempat para pendosa berdiri segar.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Se fossi domandato “Altri chi v’era?”, 119 tu hai dallato quel di Beccheria 120 di cui segò Fiorenza la gorgiera.
query.result:
**English:**
118 If you were to ask, “Who else was there?”, 119 you have at your side the one from Beccheria, 120 whose throat Florence cut.
**Malay:**
118 Jika kamu bertanya, “Siapa lagi yang ada di sana?”, 119 kamu memiliki di sisimu orang dari Beccheria, 120 yang lehernya dipotong oleh Florence.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Gianni de’ Soldanier credo che sia 122 più là con Ganellone e Tebaldello, 123 ch’aprì Faenza quando si dormia».
query.result:
**English:**
121 I believe Gianni de’ Soldanier is 122 over there with Ganelon and Tebaldello, 123 who opened Faenza while everyone was asleep.
**Malay:**
121 Aku percaya Gianni de’ Soldanier adalah 122 di sana bersama Ganelon dan Tebaldello, 123 yang membuka Faenza ketika semua orang sedang tidur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Noi eravam partiti già da ello, 125 ch’io vidi due ghiacciati in una buca, 126 sì che l’un capo a l’altro era cappello;
127 e come ’l pan per fame si manduca, 128 così ’l sovran li denti a l’altro pose 129 là ’ve ’l cervel s’aggiugne con la nuca:
130 non altrimenti Tidëo si rose 131 le tempie a Menalippo per disdegno, 132 che quei faceva il teschio e l’altre cose.
query.result:
**English:**
124 We had already departed from him, 125 when I saw two frozen in one hole, 126 so that one head was a hat for the other;
127 and as bread is eaten because of hunger, 128 so the sovereign sank his teeth into the other 129 where the brain joins the nape of the neck:
130 Tydeus did not gnaw the temples of Menalippus 131 with more fury than this one was gnawing 132 the skull and the other parts.
**Malay:**
124 Kami telah meninggalkannya, 125 ketika aku melihat dua orang membeku dalam satu lubang, 126 sehingga kepala yang satu menjadi topi bagi yang lain;
127 dan sebagaimana roti dimakan karena lapar, 128 demikianlah sang penguasa menancapkan giginya ke yang lain 129 di tempat otak bertemu dengan tengkuk:
130 Tydeus tidak menggerogoti pelipis Menalippus 131 dengan amarah yang lebih besar daripada yang dilakukan orang ini 132 pada tengkorak dan bagian-bagian lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 «O tu che mostri per sì bestial segno 134 odio sovra colui che tu ti mangi, 135 dimmi ’l perché», diss’ io, «per tal convegno,
136 che se tu a ragion di lui ti piangi, 137 sappiendo chi voi siete e la sua pecca, 138 nel mondo suso ancora io te ne cangi,
139 se quella con ch’io parlo non si secca».
query.result:
**English:**
133 "O you who show by such a bestial sign 134 hatred for him whom you devour, 135 tell me the reason," I said, "for such an agreement,
136 that if you weep for him with good reason, 137 knowing who you are and his sin, 138 in the world above I will still change your fate,
139 if that with which I speak does not dry up."
**Malay:**
133 "Wahai kamu yang menunjukkan dengan tanda yang begitu biadab 134 kebencian terhadap orang yang kamu makan, 135 katakan padaku alasannya," kataku, "untuk perjanjian seperti itu,
136 bahwa jika kamu menangisi dia dengan alasan yang baik, 137 mengetahui siapa kamu dan dosanya, 138 di dunia atas aku akan tetap mengubah nasibmu,
139 jika yang dengannya aku berbicara tidak mengering."
